subject: Problems testing an InputStream
msgSnippet: Hello, I am writing a test related to XML parsing.  In the setUp() of my test, I read an InputStream as follows: inputStream =
messageBody:
Hello,

I am writing a test related to XML parsing. In the setUp() of my test, I read
an InputStream as follows:

inputStream = this.getClass().getResourceAsStream("sample.xml");

...where sample.xml is in the same directory as my TestCase.

I then have a "sanity" check test to make sure I read the InputStream correctly:

public void testSampleInputStreamIsValid() {
assertNotNull("InputStream should not be null", inputStream);
}

When I run this from within my IDE (Eclipse), it works fine - whether I run the
test directly, or from a suite (which is in another package).

HOWEVER, whenever I run it from Ant or Maven, I get a failure (InputStream is null).

This is probably a basic question related to reading InputStreams, but I'm not
sure what is wrong. Hopefully someone can help, or refer me to some helpful
documentation.

Thanks,
Chad
